duck: The Battle of Cynoscephalae was an encounter battle fought in Thessaly in 197 BC between the Roman army, led by Titus Quinctius Flamininus, and the Antigonid dynasty of Macedon, led by Philip V.
197 BC - Year 197 BC was a year of the pre-Julian Roman calendar.

cat: Battles of Philip V of Macedon|Cynoscephalae
wiki.text:
:For the earlier battle fought here, see [[Battle of Cynoscephalae (364 BC)]]. {{Infobox military conflict |conflict=Battle of Cynoscephalae |partof=the Second Macedonian War |image= |caption=A map showing the location of Cynoscephalae. |date=197 BC |place=Thessaly |result=Decisive Roman victory |combatant1=Roman Republic
Aetolian League allies |combatant2=Macedon |commander1=T. Quinctius Flamininus |commander2=Philip V of Macedon |strength1=about 33,400 men or about the same number as the Macedonians according to Plutarch[http://penelope.u- chicago.edu/Thayer/E/Roman/Texts/Plutarch/Lives/Flamininus*.html#7 Plutarch] |strength2= 25,500 men according to Plutarch[http://penelo- pe.uchicago.edu/Thayer/E/Roman/Texts/Plutarch/Lives/Flamininus*.html#7 Plutarch] |casualties1=about 2,000 killed or wounded |casualties2=5,000 killed, 1,000 captured }} The 'Battle of Cynoscephalae' () was an encounter battle fought in Thessaly in 197 BC between the Roman army, led by Titus Quinctius Flamininus, and the Antigonid dynasty of Macedon, led by Philip V.
wiki.title: Battle%20of%20Cynoscephalae
